channel.title: Port fowarding! help! plz

item.title: Port fowarding! help! plz
item.dc:creator: @slomifier slomifier
item.description:
@slomifier wrote:

[quote=“Mladen, post:11, topic:36274”]Lol i just created this so tell me what you think

Maybe he needs help, and if you wanna port forward, you must know your private ip which and be found doing this

  1. start-> Control pannel-> Network and Internet Connections -> Then look down should be Internet Connections -> Double click on the one your internet is on -> click on support at the top -> copy your ip adress, and the one thats like 192.168.0.1.

  2. then open your internet to your homepage
    Type:http://192.168.0.1 or whatever yours is.
    Then you’ll get a screen for username and pass
    Username: Admin
    Password: “Blank” or try password or 123

  3. Should open to your router find Games and you should see port forward:

You should see this.
Put in the following.
Make sure you have a no-ip .
www.no-ip.com and register download client make a new no-ip and your done!

“o” Enabled o Disabled
Name: Mopar
Private IP: “your ip adresss”
Protocol Type: Both
Private Port: 43594
Public Port: 43594

go to the link in my signature and please say i helped you
Schedule: Always[/quote]

Theres a couple problems with your post…
“1. start-> Control pannel-> Network and Internet Connections -> Then look down should be Internet Connections -> Double click on the one your internet is on -> click on support at the top -> copy your ip adress, and the one thats like 192.168.0.1.”

^Another way that I like that makes me feel smart, is:
“Start” -> “Run” -> type “cmd” -> than type “ipconfig” in the java box -> Find a thing called “default gateway” -> Look for the number beside it. Mine looks like 192.168.1.2."

“Then you’ll get a screen for username and pass
Username: Admin
Password: “Blank” or try password or 123”

^This is untrue. It depends which kind of router you have. I have a linksys, so its
Blank
Admin

There, I said it.

Read full topic

item.title: Port fowarding! help! plz
item.dc:creator: @Mladen Mladen
item.description:
@Mladen wrote:

Lol i just created this so tell me what you think

Maybe he needs help, and if you wanna port forward, you must know your private ip which and be found doing this

  1. start-> Control pannel-> Network and Internet Connections -> Then look down should be Internet Connections -> Double click on the one your internet is on -> click on support at the top -> copy your ip adress, and the one thats like 192.168.0.1.

  2. then open your internet to your homepage
    Type:http://192.168.0.1 or whatever yours is.
    Then you’ll get a screen for username and pass
    Username: Admin
    Password: “Blank” or try password or 123

  3. Should open to your router find Games and you should see port forward:

You should see this.
Put in the following.
Make sure you have a no-ip .
www.no-ip.com and register download client make a new no-ip and your done!

“o” Enabled o Disabled
Name: Mopar
Private IP: “your ip adresss”
Protocol Type: Both
Private Port: 43594
Public Port: 43594

go to the link in my signature and please say i helped you
Schedule: Always

Read full topic

item.title: Port fowarding! help! plz
item.dc:creator: @sidsidsid sidsidsid
item.description:
@sidsidsid wrote:

[quote=“Mrquarter, post:4, topic:36274”]When you start up, it always says “Starting Testscape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594…”

It always says that. It means it started and its on port 43594 with the no-ip you have as the ip. Ok so it’s all fine.[/quote]

i tried it it didnt work help out plz plz plz thanx a lot i wanna get this server up and workin

im also on my msn - imgonnagetusoon2@hotmail.com

item.title: Port fowarding! help! plz
item.dc:creator: @Mrquarter Mrquarter
item.description:
@Mrquarter wrote:

When you start up, it always says “Starting Testscape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594…”

It always says that. It means it started and its on port 43594 with the no-ip you have as the ip. Ok so it’s all fine.
